articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Congratulations to Russia's President-elect
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Congratulations to Russia's President-elect
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un on Tuesday sent a congratulatory message to Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin, president-elect of Russia.
					 The message said:
					
					 I offer my congratulations to you upon your election as president of the Russian Federation.
					
					 I wish you achievement in your responsible work for building a powerful Russia, expressing belief that the traditional bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation would grow stronger as required by the agreements between the two countries and in the interests of the two peoples.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Extends Special Thanks to Mansudae Art Studio
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Extends Special Thanks to Mansudae Art Studio 
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un sent a message of special thanks to the creators, employees and officials of the Mansudae Art Studio for their distinguished exploits in the work for upholding General Secretary Kim Jong Il as in his lifetime for all ages. 
					 In the message he expressed special thanks to them in the name of the Supreme Commander of the KPA. 
					
					 Officials and creators, with ardent yearning for Kim Jong Il, depicted his smiling portrait at the highest level and made contributions to successfully ensuring the last farewell-bidding ceremony and memorial service. 
					
					 By erecting the bronze statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il riding on horses as a great masterpiece, they rendered distinguished services to glorifying the great personalities of the peerlessly brilliant commanders of Mt. Paektu and holding them in high esteem generation after generation. 
					
					 Kim Jong Un in his message highly appreciated the exploits performed by the officials, creators and employees of the Mansudae Art Studio. 
					
					 A ceremony of conveying the message took place at the studio on Tuesday. 
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea, and officials, creators and employees of the studio. 
					
					 Speeches were made.

articles.title: CPRK Secretariat Decries "North Wind" Raised by Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
CPRK Secretariat Decries "North Wind" Raised by Lee Myung Bak 
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- The Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea (CPRK) released information bulletin No. 993 Tuesday at the time when the army and people of the DPRK are running high in their wrath against the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors and the spirit to annihilate it. The bulletin said:
					 The Lee group, sworn enemy, hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK and kicked up "north wind", stunning the public at home and abroad.
					
					 Some time ago, the puppet group held a trial of those allegedly related to the so-called spy ring case whose investigation it had been calling for since last year, and inflicted heavy penalties on them linking them to the DPRK for no reason.
					
					 It also harshly suppressed the publisher and representative of the progressive magazine Minjok 21 and others related to it, alleging that they were co-opted by the DPRK and conducted "espionage activities". 
					
					 Meanwhile, it also let the riff-raffs tarnish the international image of the DPRK and kicked up smear campaign by the use of hack media to justify its confrontation policy. It also intensified the "security education" of young generation and the puppet army and instilled the hostile feelings towards the fellow countrymen into them, citing possible provocation from someone.
					
					 Not satisfied with waging madcap war exercises against the north with the U.S., the puppet group perpetrated heinous provocation of hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK and is working with bloodshot eyes to fabricate the "north wind". This clearly proves once again their nature as die-hard confrontation maniacs. 
					
					 The group's desperate effort is aimed to lift it from the catastrophic crisis, diverting elsewhere the public opinion and tilt the election situation in its favor.
					
					 Historically, the south Korean puppets left no means untried to block the advance of the progressive forces and turn public opinion critical of the "government" in its favor with the fabrication of the "north wind" cases whenever they faced the ruling crises ahead of the elections.
					
					 The Lee group, too, is without exception. It attempted to raise the "north wind" by fabricating one after another such provocations as the "Cheonan" case and the Yonphyong island shelling incident and the anti-DPRK smear campaigns with the use of riff-raffs before the elections including local autonomous election and by-election.
					
					 But they triggered greater wrath of the people and its isolation.
					
					 Far from learning a lesson from it, the Lee group is trying to get rid of the worst dilemma in another "north wind" just like a drowning man catching at a straw.
					
					 It is mistaken if it calculates it can distract the public with such a stereotyped publicity stunt and evade ruin by slandering the fellow countrymen.
					
					 The fabrication of the "north wind" will give rise to stronger anti-Lee Myung Bak and anti-Saenuri Party storm, hastening the ruin of the group of traitors.

articles.title: Joint Photo Exhibition to Be Held in New York to Mark Day of Sun
articles.content:
Joint Photo Exhibition to Be Held in New York to Mark Day of Sun
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- A photo exhibition co-sponsored by the Korean Central News Agency and AP will be held in New York to mark the significant Day of the Sun, the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 On display at the exhibition will be photos on the DPRK separately prepared by the two agencies under MoU signed between the KCNA and AP in June last year. 
					
					 Those concerned of the KCNA who selected photos for exhibition together with AP said the exhibition will display photos of the great men of Mt. Paektu who made immortal contributions to the prosperity of the country, its people's happiness, the independent and peaceful reunification of the country and the accomplishment of the cause of global independence. 
					
					 There will be on display also photos on various fields of the DPRK including politics, economy and culture.
					
					 The exhibition will provide an opportunity to compare the different styles of photography between the two news agencies, and will give exhibition goers a visual understanding of the country rare for Western audiences, according to Santiago Lyon, AP's director of photography. 
					
					 The exhibition will help towards deepening the confidence between the peoples of the DPRK and the U.S. and improving the bilateral relations.

articles.title: Worker-Peasant Red Guards of DPRK Ready for Action
articles.content:
Worker-Peasant Red Guards of DPRK Ready for Action
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army in a statement on Friday disclosed that a south Korean army unit in Inchon carelessly hung portraits of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu on walls and doors, scrawling unspeakable defamatory words below them.
					 Infuriated at this high treason, members of the Worker-Peasant Red Guards, powerful civilian forces of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, immediately advanced into a posture of readiness for action.
					
					 A commanding officer of the Guards, Kim Chang Gon, told KCNA:
					
					 "We are waiting for an order to advance southward to punish traitor Lee Myung Bak and his lackeys Kim Kwan Jin and Jong Sung Jo, the masterminds of the treason."
					
					 A commanding officer, Han Song Min, said:
					
					 "It's high time for us to destroy the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors, who sticks to confrontation with the DPRK, bereft of reason."
					
					 A member Pak Myong Chol said:
					
					 "Once a sacred war is declared, I will fire shells at the headquarters of the Lee group and reduce it to ashes."

articles.title: Provincial Rallies Vow to Destroy Lee Myung Bak Group
articles.content:
Provincial Rallies Vow to Destroy Lee Myung Bak Group
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Servicepersons and people in North Phyongan and Kangwon provinces held rallies on Tuesday to vow to wage a merciless sacred war to destroy the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors who hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK.
					 The statement of the spokesman for the Supreme Command of Korean People's Army was read out. It was followed by speeches made by the chief secretaries of the provincial committees of the Workers' Party of Korea and those on behalf of the KPA service members, Worker-Peasant Red Guards and youth and students.
					
					 The speakers said burning in the hearts of all the servicepersons and people is the fighting spirit to annihilate the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors in the merciless sacred war of Korean style as it dared hurt the dignity of the great men of Mt. Paektu whom the Koreans regard dearer than their lives and defend at any cost.
					
					  Once the Supreme Commander gives an order, they would reduce the Chongwadae of traitor Lee into ashes at one go and blow up the bases of the anti-DPRK smear campaign and moves for provocation of war, they pledged. 
					
					 They said they would be on fullest alert to give momentum to the atmosphere of great leap and innovation in the ongoing grand advance for building an economic power and improving the people's living standard in the same spirit of tearing apart the Lee group. 
					
					 The rallies were followed by demonstrations.
					
					 The demonstrators marched in high spirits, holding posters reading "Those who provoke us can not evade death!" and "Vengeful blow to the thrice-cursed traitor Lee Myung Bak!" in their hands.

articles.title: Agricultural Workers and Women Renew Pledge to Wipe out Lee Myung Bak Group
articles.content:
Agricultural Workers and Women Renew Pledge to Wipe out Lee Myung Bak Group
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Meetings of the Union of Agricultural Workers' of Korea (UAWK) and other agricultural workers and Korean women took place in Sinchon and Kaesong on Tuesday. The participants renewed their pledge to take thousand-fold revenge upon the group of traitor Lee Myung Bak who hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK. 
					 The statement issued by a spokesman for the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army was read out to be followed by speeches at the meetings. 
					
					 At the meeting of members of UAWK and agricultural workers held in Sinchon County, speakers declared that the army and people of the DPRK will kill dog Myung Bak and his servants and delete their names from the list of mankind as early as possible. 
					
					 All the union members and agricultural workers should regard their own fields as the first-line trench assigned by the country and do farm work in the militant and revolutionary way, the speakers said. They went on saying they should always maintain strained and mobilized posture and get themselves prepared as required by the prevailing situation holding a rifle in one hand and a sickle in the other hand. 
					
					 At the meeting of Korean women held in Phyonghwa-ri, Kaesong City the speakers declared they would kill Lee Myung Bak group of traitors and all their family members. 
					
					 All the women will firmly protect the authority of the great persons of Mt. Paektu and politically and ideologically defend the dear respected Kim Jong Un at the cost of their lives following the examples displayed during the hard-fought days and thus become today's Choe Hui Suk, An Yong Ae and Jo Ok Hui, by inheriting the spirit of devotedly defending the leader. 
					
					 They pledged to forcefully push one of the wheels of the revolutionary chariot in a strained posture and put forward their husbands and children to the van of the death-defying battles and become good wives and genuine mothers in the Songun era by fully assisting the people's army. 
					
					 An indignation statement was read out at the meeting.

articles.title: Service Personnel of KPA 4th Corps Express Their Will to Mercilessly Punish Lee Group
articles.content:
Service Personnel of KPA 4th Corps Express Their Will to Mercilessly Punish Lee Group
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- The service personnel of the 4th Corps of the Korean People's Army who meted out a stern punishment to military hooligans on Yonphyong Island two years ago are firmly determined to make a clean sweep of the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors who committed the hysterical act of impairing the prestige of the great men of Mt. Paektu.
					 They are now fully ready to wage a decisive battle and renewing their resolution to mercilessly punish the group of traitors with thousand-fold retaliatory strikes.
					
					 Commander of the Corps Pyon In Son declared the time has come when the powerful revolutionary army of the DPRK should show the world how it severely punishes the provokers with all-out retaliatory strikes and fights an indiscriminate battle to turn their citadels into seas in flames.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 As a puppy knows no fear of a tiger, the group of traitors does not know well how deadly the strikes of our powerful revolutionary army are.
					
					 Once our army corps' artillery pieces open fire all at once, either Seoul or Inchon will be engulfed in flames and no enemy will survive our strikes.
					
					   The hearts of the servicepersons of the corps who level the artillery pieces ready to annihilate the enemies at the dens of the group of traitors are full of burning hatred for it.
					
					 The service personnel of the artillery units are waiting for the issue of an order to fire, keeping Paekryong, Taechong and Sochong islands and others, the enemy's outposts for launching aggression and hatching plots, within sighting telescopes. They are renewing their resolution to wipe out the sworn enemies with showers of shells.
					
					   Division Commander Ryang Yong Chol stated that the commanding officers and men of his division would turn Paekryong Island where the 6th marine brigade of the puppet army is stationed into a sea with strikes much more powerful than those which reduced Yonphyong Island into a sea in flames before, once a sacred war of Korean style.
					
					 Officer of a sub-unit under the division Ri Chol Bok pledged himself to fire shells at the group of traitors in Chongwadae and villains in Inchon as the first shelling for a great war for national reunification.
					
					 Regiment Commander Kim Kyong Su had this to say:
					
					 The service personnel of our unit fully ready to take revenge upon the enemies will wipe out all the rogues to the last one as they perpetrated the worst provocations.
					
					 Brigade Commander Yun Yong Sik declared once the respected Supreme Commander issues an order, his unit would mercilessly punish the group of traitors and make it clearly realize what the real strikes and firings of the strong army of Mt. Paektu are like.

articles.title: Service Personnel of KPA 2nd Corps Vow to Blow up Chongwadae
articles.content:
Service Personnel of KPA 2nd Corps Vow to Blow up Chongwadae
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- The service personnel of the 2nd Corps of the Korean People's Army (KPA) defending an area near south Korea are keeping themselves combat ready and anxiously waiting for an attack order. 
					 They, trembling with towering grudge against those who hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK, are poised for attack with their guns leveled at Chongwadae, hotbed of evils, as well as Inchon hooligans without equal in the world are stationing.
					
					 Self-propelled artillery pieces and multiple launch rocket systems are firing shells in the firing ranges, reflection of the spirit of a-match-for-a hundred service persons to wipe out traitor Lee Myung Bak and his stooges. Loud shouts "Beat Myung Bak to death" and "Let's beat military warmongers to death" are heard in the firing ranges.
					
					  Kim Hyong Ryong, commander of the Corps, said:
					
					 I became an officer of the KPA under the care of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and stand in the forefront of the sacred war for the country's reunification.
					
					 We, all the servicepersons of the Corps, are getting ourselves fully ready to conquer Chongwadae, the den of human scum, so that we may retaliate against the group of traitors who deserve death by dismemberment. 
					
					 If the supreme commander issues an order, the 2nd Corps of the KPA will destroy at a blow the puppet 3rd Field Army just off the forefront of the north side and conquer Seoul and Inchon at a go. Therefore, we will demonstrate the might of the invincible corps of the KPA and show them what a real war would mean.
					
					 Deputy Commander Ri Kum Chol said:
					
					 Upon hearing the statement of a spokesman for the Supreme Command of the KPA, I am waiting for an order of fire together with soldiers at positions of artillery units replete with the spirit to turn Seoul and Inchon into ashes. 
					
					 He said that traitors including Lee Myung Bak, Kim Kwan Jin and Jong Sung Jo can never flee from firepower of all types of large-caliber artillery pieces and multiple launch rocket systems.
					
					 Division Commander O Kwang Su said that his unit is a tough division called a tiger, which performed distinguished feats in various battles including the battle to liberate Seoul and the battle to liberate Taejon in the period of the Fatherland Liberation War. The division will fly the DPRK flag for the first time in the sky over Seoul on the day when it advances to it, he added.
					
					 Brigade Commander Ri Song Ho, who drove a tank to the starting line, stressed the need to fully demonstrate the spirit of soldiers, each being a-match-for-a hundred, while fluttering the flag of the Supreme Commander like the tankmen during the war.

articles.title: Increasing Number of Young People Volunteer to Join or Rejoin Army
articles.content:
Increasing Number of Young People Volunteer to Join or Rejoin Army
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Upon hearing the statement issued by the spokesman for the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army (KPA), an increasing number of young people in various parts of the country are volunteering to join or rejoin the KPA. 
					 The number of those youths has reached more than 1.94 million.
					
					 In North Hwanghae Province alone, more than 176 540 young people did so.
					
					 Tens of thousands of students of universities and colleges in Sariwon City held a meeting for the above-said purposes.
					
					 Written on the petitions are "Let's crush Lee Myung Bak, idiot without an equal in the world and other gangsters" and other letters.
					
					 A meeting took place in Songchon County to vow to seek a revenge with 11 120 young people attending. The venue of the meeting shook with shouts of such slogans as "Let us wipe out troops in Inchon City to last one" and "Finish off mercilessly Kim Kwan Jin and Jong Sung Jo in the name of the nation."
					
					 Young people in Ongjin County, South Hwanghae Province, and Cholwon County, Kangwon Province, declared they would become human bullets and bombs and turn the whole bulwarks of the enemies into seas in flames once an order is issued by the respected Supreme Commander.
					
					 More than 5 280 secondary school graduates across the country who had exams for higher schools are also volunteering to join the KPA.

articles.title: Korean People's Growing Anger at S. Korean Regime's Deeds
articles.content:
Korean People's Growing Anger at S. Korean Regime's Deeds
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Growing stronger is the Korean people's hatred toward south Korea's Lee Myung Bak regime, which recently dared hurt the dignity of the DPRK supreme leadership.
					 The Lee group of traitors carelessly hung portraits of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu, whom the Koreans regard as the sun, on walls and doors of barracks of a military unit, scrawling unspeakable defamatory words below them.
					
					 This insult to the great persons, who built the best socialist system centered on the popular masses and bolstered national strength, is just that to the servicepersons and civilians of the DPRK who have deeply revered their leaders, regarding them as their own father and mother.
					
					 Such behavior is tantamount to a declaration of war.
					
					 All the Korean people have turned out in a sacred war for vengeance, saying that it is impossible to achieve national reconciliation and unity unless the Lee group of traitors, the scum of history, is punished.
					
					 The revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK are waiting for an order to advance toward the south with their powerful striking means unknown to the world while five million youths are vowing to take revenge on the thrice-cursed traitors.
					
					 The citizens of all ages and sexes are determined to cut off and club to death Lee Myung Bak, calling him Kaebak (mad dog) and Jwibak (rat).

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Cursed by Korean People for High Treasons
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Cursed by Korean People for High Treasons
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Despite the repeated warnings of the DPRK, the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors in south Korea again dared defame the dignity of its supreme leadership recently.
					 Such hideous provocation made the people in the DPRK go beyond the limits in reason and self-control.  
					
					 They term the Lee group mad dogs, demanding that those dogs be beaten to death. 
					
					 This is a stern punishment given by the nation to the group of traitors who have engaged themselves only in unethical and treacherous acts over the past four years. 
					
					 Due to its war and confrontation moves, the Korean nation's desire for peace and reunification has not yet been realized, but dark clouds of war are persisting over the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 The Lee group of traitors can be no longer pardoned as its high treasons were committed when the Koreans were mourning over the great loss to the nation.
					
					 The servicepersons and civilians of the DPRK are waiting for an order to advance toward the south so as to punish such evils as traitor Lee Myung Bak and his lackeys and defend peace.

articles.title: Poems Reflecting Indignation and Resolution to Annihilate Enemy Created
articles.content:
Poems Reflecting Indignation and Resolution to Annihilate Enemy Created
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Poems are now being created to reflect the towering resentment at the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors for all ages and the will of all service personnel and people to take revenge upon it. 
					 Not only poets and string correspondents but servicepersons and people from all walks of life wrote a lot of poems in a few days with burning indignation and resolution to annihilate the enemy. 
					
					 Poets of the Central Committee of the Writers Union of Korea made public dozens of poems.
					
					 They include poems titled "Now is the time to settle accounts", "Soldier is ready to pull the trigger", "Brilliant commander of Mt. Paektu, give us an order", etc. They reflect the feelings of all the service personnel and people all out in the sacred war to wipe out the group of traitors and their determination to blow up the citadels of the enemies at one strike, should the dear respected Kim Jong Un issue an order. 
					
					  Poems were created by servicepersons and people in various parts of the country to condemn the warmongers' reckless acts and call for an all-people battle for revenge. These poems encourage the popular masses in the sacred war for devotedly protecting the leader and defending the country.
					
					 Among them are a poem written by a KPA soldier "The Supreme Command Declares", "We Will Punish Lee Myung Bak Group, Mad Dogs," a poem recited by a head of the construction regiment of the C.C., the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League at the construction site of Mansudae area, and "We Cannot Repress Our Resentment," a poem written by a teacher of Kim Hyong Jik University of Education.   They represent the pledges to crush the group of traitors which committed the high treason which makes even animals blush.
					
					 An ordinary housewife wrote a poem "I Volunteer," deeply impressed by her daughter's act of volunteering to join the KPA. A worker recited a poem "Declaration of Wrath" while operating his machine in the spirit of crushing the enemies. They reflect the thoughts and resolution of all the people to protect their worthwhile life and happiness and the dignified system in the DPRK at the cost of their lives.

articles.title: Poems Showing Retaliatory Spirit Created in DPRK
articles.content:
Poems Showing Retaliatory Spirit Created in DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Poets and other people of the DPRK have written indignation poems with their towering anger and hatred toward south Korea's Lee Myung Bak regime, which committed high treason by hurting the dignity of their supreme leadership. Among those poems published is "Brilliant Commander of Mt. Paektu, Please Give Us Your Order". 
					 Tens of poems have been created since the release of the statement of a spokesman for the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army, Mun Yong Chol, chief of the panel of poetry literature of the C.C., Writers Union of Korea, told KCNA. 
					
					 They include "We Can No Longer Stand", "It's Time to Finally Settle Accounts" and "By Angry Force of Arms" that all reflect the strong will of the servicepersons and people to destroy at one stroke the headquarters of the enemies and take thousand-fold revenge upon them. 
					
					 Those poems are aired daily through TV and radio in the country to encourage all the people to a sacred war of justice.

articles.title: Korean People Inspired by Song
articles.content:
Korean People Inspired by Song 
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Inspired by the song "Leader, Just Give Us Your Order", servicepersons and civilians of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea harden their determination to take a full-fledged revenge upon south Korea's Lee Myung Bak group of traitors who committed the hideous provocation against the dignity of the DPRK supreme leadership.
					 Created in Juche 56 (1967), the song reflects the steadfast will of Koreans to wipe out south Korea's traitors and the U.S. aggression forces at the cost of their life.
					
					 Kim Song Un, chief engineer at the Pyongyang 326 Electric Wire Factory, who attended the serviceperson-civilian rally held in Pyongyang Sunday, told KCNA:
					
					 "The song reminds me of the spring days of the year 1993. In those days, too, we, servicepersons and civilians, inspired by the song, firmly defended the country from provocateurs at home and abroad, in response to the order of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, which called on the country, the people and the army to advance into the semi-war state.
					
					 Along with this song, we will destroy by force of arms such traitors to the nation as Lee Myung Bak, Kim Kwan Jin and Jong Sung Jo, and reunify Korea."

articles.title: Korean People, Encouraged by War Movies
articles.content:
Korean People, Encouraged by War Movies
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- War movies have been telecast in DPRK more than usual after the announcement of the statement of a spokesman for the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army (KPA) on March 2.  The statement hit at south Korea's Lee Myong Bak regime for its insult to the dignity of the DPRK supreme leadership.
					 Those war movies include "Don't Wait for Us", "Notes of a War Correspondent" and "Morning Star".
					
					 The movies, popular especially among young people, lively represent the spirit of devotedly defending the leader KPA men and officers displayed in the Fatherland Liberation War (1950-1953).

articles.title: Foreign Guests Visit Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Visit Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Delegates of China, Netherlands, Denmark, Germany, United States, UK and Canada and the executive director of the Environmental Education Media Project who came her to take part in the International Seminar on Forest and Landscape Restoration Tuesday visited equestrian statues of President Kim Il Sung and Generak Secretary Kim Jong Il at the Mansudae Art Studio.
					 They placed a floral basket before the statues in reverence for the President and the leader who made great contributions to the cause of global independence before paying tribute to them. 
					
					 The guests arrived here on Tuesday.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Singaporean Organization
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Singaporean Organization
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a gift from the Manufacturer's Federation of Singapore on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star.
					 The director of the federation handed the gift to the DPRK ambassador to the country on March 1.

articles.title: New Postage Stamp Issued in DPRK for Int'l Exposition
articles.content:
New Postage Stamp Issued in DPRK for Int'l Exposition 
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- The Sweden 2012 Frimung-Huddex International Exposition of Philately took place on Saturday and Sunday in Huddinge.
					 The State Stamp Bureau of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea issued a commemorative stamp (sheetlet) for the exposition.
					
					 Printed on the upper part of the stamp are an emblem of the exposition and its English title. Depicted in it are rabbits hopping in grassland.

articles.title: Miserable Plight of Women in Capitalist Countries
articles.content:
Miserable Plight of Women in Capitalist Countries
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Women in capitalist countries have their elementary rights wantonly infringed upon and fall victim to all social evils.
					 In the United States discrimination against women finds its vivid manifestation in payment of wages.
					
					 According to a survey, female workers were reportedly paid 25 percent less than male workers on average in recent years.
					
					 Women in Japan are the primary targets of discharge.
					
					 One of three women is distressed by poverty, according to a survey made by the Japanese government early in February.
					
					 Women in capitalist society fall victim to various crimes including family violence and sexual abuse, withering hopelessly.
					
					 According to a recent survey, the number of the women who were subject to violence by their husbands and others in the U.S. reached 29 million.
					
					 According to a survey cited by the Japan Police Agency, in 2010 the number of cases of family violence increased 20 percent over that in 2009, reaching over 33,850 cases.
					
					 It is said that women met death due to family violence, one in three days in France and two in a week in Britain.
					
					 The European Council announced the fact that 12-15 percent of women in European countries have become victims of violence. This fact clearly proves the gravity of the violence against women.
					
					 As seen above, women in capitalist countries are in despair and get degenerate, deploring their miserable fate. This leads them to crimes.

articles.title: Developing Countries Make Efforts to Solve Women Problem
articles.content:
Developing Countries Make Efforts to Solve Women Problem
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Developing countries have made women's problem one of priorities and paid deep attention to it.
					 Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad said that Iranian women have played positive roles not only in households but in various fabrics of society.
					
					 Brazilian President Dilma Vana Rousseff said that present home situation requires many women's taking part in the social labor, calling for getting rid of the tendency of giving priority to men in work.
					
					 She clarified her stand to maintain the government policy for steadily providing women with jobs.
					
					 The minister of Science, Technology and Vocational Training of Zambia expressed the government stand not to allow the discrimination against women in various fields of socio-economic life. 
					
					 Philippines President Benigno Simeon Cojuangco Aquino signed new law on the protection of women workers.
					
					 The Bangladeshi parliament adopted a bill on protecting women and children from family violence.
					
					 The country shaped a new policy to enhance the position of women. The Cameroon government plans to develop public health to reduce the death rate of women in child-bed and children 75 percent by 2015 while the Nigerian government takes steps to increase the role of maternity nurses in the rural areas.
					
					 The cancer check-up took place in Brazil with main emphasis on the early diagnosis and treatment of breast cancer and uterine cancer.
					
					 A university for women was established in Riyadh for the first time in Saudi Arabia. 
					
					 Meanwhile, the ALBA member states set up the ministerial-level committee for ensuring the sex equality and make joint efforts for women's presence in the building of a new society.

articles.title: Korean People's Indiscriminate Sacred War Is Just Measure for Self-defence: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Korean People's Indiscriminate Sacred War Is Just Measure for Self-defence: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- The traitor Lee Myung Bak group's acts of hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the army and people of the DPRK were by no means accidental but premeditated actions to extremely rattle its nerves in a bid to escalate the tension and ignite a war against the DPRK.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes this in a bylined article. 
					
					 Now that the Lee group deliberately perpetrated the gravest political and military provocation to start a war against the north, it is quite natural to resolutely frustrate its moves, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army in a statement of its spokesman solemnly declared internally and externally that it would launch an indiscriminate sacred war of its own style to make a clean sweep of the worst traitor Lee Myung Bak from this land. This is a just self-defence measure reflecting the will and wishes of the people of the DPRK and all other Koreans. 
					
					 There are no people who would remain a passive onlooker after their dignity had been hurt. The DPRK is shedding its rays as the most dignified and great independent power as it is holding President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il in high esteem. Nothing is greater honor for the Korean people to hold the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu in high esteem as they put the pride of the nation on the highest level. That is why all the people of the DPRK regard it as the highest honor and greatest happiness to live with the portraits of their leaders hung with the greatest care. 
					
					 It is too late to warn those who have neither elementary etiquette nor morality as human beings. The Lee group no better than mad dogs should be beaten with a stick to death. 
					
					 The DPRK never makes an empty talk.

articles.title: What Does U.S. Warship's Entry into S. Korean Port Seek?: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
What Does U.S. Warship's Entry into S. Korean Port Seek?: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, "Blue Ridge," a flagship of the U.S. Seventh Fleet, entered Tonghae Port of Kangwon Province of south Korea. The authorities of the U.S. forces in south Korea claim the portcall by "Blue Ridge" is for what they called "exchange" and "cultural event," asserting it is irrelevant to the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 "Blue Ridge" entered south Korea for taking part in the war drills to get familiar on the spot with the tactics for invading the north, to intents and purposes.
					
					 This is clear from the fact that "Blue Ridge" has never missed Key Resolve and Foal Eagle staged in south Korea every year.
					
					 It is the scenario of the U.S. to let "Blue Ridge" play a pivotal role in the above-said exercises for a pre-emptive strike at the DPRK.
					
					 "Blue Ridge's" purpose can also be evidenced by the fact that its portcall is not on Pusan as before but on Tonghae Port near from the Military Demarcation Line.
					
					 The prevailing situation goes to prove that it is none other than the U.S. and the south Korean authorities who escalate the military confrontation and tension on the Korean Peninsula through reckless political and military provocations in an effort to increase the danger of war.

articles.title: U.S. Policy of War toward DPRK Bound to Go Bust: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S. Policy of War toward DPRK Bound to Go Bust: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- The ruling quarters of the U.S. consider the DPRK situated in the part of Northeast Asia of strategic importance as a stumbling block in carrying out their strategy for world domination in the 21st century and are, therefore, keen to stifle it by force of arms, backed by the Lee Myung Bak puppet group of south Korea.
					 Rodong Sinmun on Tuesday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 It is, however, nothing but a daydream for the U.S. to bring down the DPRK by force with the south Korean puppet forces as a shock brigade, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. policy of strength to conquer the DPRK by force of arms is nothing but a hopeless gamble.
					
					 Another Korean War will only entail the miserable consequences of leading the U.S. to an abyss of ruin.
					
					 If the U.S. imperialists ignite a war in Korea, the army and people of the DPRK will open the flood gates of pent-up grudge and make merciless and deadly strikes at the aggressors. 
					
					 The DPRK is fully ready to crush any imperialist aggressors.
					
					 They are keen to provoke a war by using warmongers of the south Korean military as a shock brigade, but the Korean people remain unfazed by these moves.
					
					 The Korean Peninsula, a strategic vantage point for the U.S. imperialists, will be reduced to their pitfall.
					
					 If the U.S. wants to escape bitterer disgrace, it should quit the peninsula.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists' policy of war to stifle the DPRK using mad dogs as a shock force is bound to go bust.

articles.title: Japanese Imperialists' Vandalism and Plunder of Cultural Properties under Fire
articles.content:
Japanese Imperialists' Vandalism and Plunder of Cultural Properties under Fire
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Japan should make the earliest possible apology and reparation for all its past crimes including vandalism and plunder of Korean cultural properties, properly understanding the Korean people's hatred for Japan and their will to force it to do so.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday urges this in a bylined article. 
					
					 The Japanese imperialist aggressors' plunder of Korean cultural relics was something unprecedented in history.
					
					 They dug up at least 200 royal mausoleums and 11,000 ancient tombs to loot treasures during their occupation of Korea. Their amount is uncountable.
					
					 Hirobumi Ito took away more than 10 truck loads of treasures from King Kongmin Mausoleum. 
					
					 In his wake Terauchi, first "resident-general" of Korea, additionally promulgated "regulations on preserving ancient sites and historic relics." He exercised the power of the "Residency-General" to cordon off the spot and robbed Korea of historic relics of the Korean nation amid a terror-ridden atmosphere.
					
					 The Japanese imperialists' brutal vandalism and plunder of Korean cultural properties, the spiritual and material heritages handed by ancestors, are thrice-cursed crimes as they were aimed to stamp out the cultural tradition and soul of the Korean nation and obliterate it. 
					
					 It is more than half a century since the defeat of the Japanese imperialists. But nobody can guess how many items of cultural properties out of those looted by them from Korea still remain unknown.
					
					 The cultural properties are the precious treasures of the country and the nation which cannot be bartered for anything.

articles.title: Japan Should Opt to Redress Its Past: Minju Joson
articles.content:
Japan Should Opt to Redress Its Past: Minju Joson 
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- There took place in Australia on Feb. 19 a memorial for hundreds of people who fell victims to the air raids by the imperial Japanese Army in February 1942 during the Second World War. 
					 The Australian prime minister in the event said that "1942 was the darkest year in the history of the country", expressing his bitter grief.
					
					 Minju Joson in a bylined commentary Tuesday says his words are indicative of the severe wounds, caused by Japan's past crimes, still remaining unhealed in the minds of the people even though more than half a century has passed since the end of the war.
					
					 Citing facts to prove that Japan committed hideous crimes against humanity unprecedented in the history during the Second World War, the commentary goes on:
					
					 In Korea alone, the Japanese imperialists killed more than one million innocent Koreans in cold blood.
					
					 This being a hard fact, the Japanese reactionaries have justified Japan's colonial policy toward Korea. They insist that Japan "protected Korea from the aggression by the European powers", it "contributed to the development and promotion of the industry of Korea", and the "issue of comfort women for the imperial Japanese army was a deed done by individual prostitution businessmen".
					
					 This proves that the Japanese reactionaries are as brutal as their ancestors who had been obsessed by manslaughter.
					
					 Lots of the souls who suffered at the hands of the Japanese imperialists are still cursing Japan.
					
					 Japan is seeking to evade its responsibility while persistently denying the crime-woven history stained with the blood of the Asian people. Its impudent attitude is bound to bring its destruction.
					
					 If Japan is afraid of final doom, it should opt to redress its past wrongdoings at an early date.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on People's Pledge to Punish Lee Myung Bak Group of Traitors
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on People's Pledge to Punish Lee Myung Bak Group of Traitors
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Tuesday editorially says that the statement released by the spokesman for the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army reflects the faith and will of the army and people of the DPRK to wipe out at one blow those who hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK.
					 The editorial goes on:
					
					 What remains to be done now is only physical showdown to finally settle accounts with the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors.
					
					 It is the firm determination of the DPRK army and people to blow up those who hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK and their stronghold.
					
					 Those who spearheaded the case were traitor Lee, Defense Minister Kim Kwan Jin, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Jong Sung Jo and other military warmongers.
					
					 The DPRK will continue its own-style sacred war with main emphasis on physical attack till all acts of hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK are brought to a definite end and Lee Myung Bak and other military warmongers and culprits are punished in the name of the nation and they make an apology before the nation for their high treason.
					
					 No force on earth can bar the dynamic advance of the DPRK army and people who are burning with towering anger and resentment and firm resolution to annihilate the enemies.
					
					 The DPRK will destroy the den of the group of traitors and stronghold of aggression by mobilizing even military potentials which the world does not know, if it is necessary for waging the sacred war for retaliation.
					
					 No enemies will be able to survive the merciless sacred war of the DPRK army and people who turned out to devotedly defend their leader and social system, concludes the editorial.

articles.title: Park Geun Hye's Anti-DPRK Remarks Assailed: Minju Joson
articles.content:
Park Geun Hye's Anti-DPRK Remarks Assailed: Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Park Geun Hye, who held power of the Saenuri Party of south Korea a few days ago, said the "north's access to nukes can never be tolerated" and the "north is at the moment of important option."
					 This is sophism ignorant of why the DPRK accessed nuke and how much south Korea is benefited from it, says Minju Joson Tuesday in a bylined commentary.
					
					 As well known, it was the U.S. which compelled the DPRK to gain access to nukes, the paper says.
					
					 But for the DPRK's nuclear deterrent the U.S. might have launched nuclear war against the DPRK dozens of times, the paper says, adding:
					
					 If Park has an iota of soul of the Korean nation, she should protest the U.S. which wages the DPRK-targeted nuclear war drills after deploying in south Korea nuclear weapons enough to exterminate the Korean nation hundreds of times.
					
					 But she hurt the fellow countrymen who saved the nation from being plunged into a nuclear war, disclosing her confrontation-minded nature.
					
					 Park is so wretched as she revealed her political ignorance through remarks unbecoming to her.
					
					 With nothing can Park cover up her true colors as a confrontational maniac as she is little different from traitor Lee Myung Bak.
					
					 A rumor in south Korea puts it that if the Saenuri Party retakes power a war will follow.
					
					 Park's recent remarks prove that the rumor is by no means groundless.

articles.title: S. Korean Organizations Vow to Get Registration Fee Halved
articles.content:
S. Korean Organizations Vow to Get Registration Fee Halved
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Organizations of students and youths formed the "Action Headquarters for Making the National Assembly Work for Halved Registration Fee" on March 4, according to the south Korean MBC. They included the south Korean Federation of University Students in the 21st Century and students committees of the Democratic United Party and the United Progressive Party.
					 The organizations in the inauguration declaration said that they would strive for the formation of the "National Assembly" which would work to halve the registration fee through the upcoming parliamentary election.
					
					 As an immediate step, they will wage a large-scale action of students in Seoul on March 30 to vow to get the registration fee halved, they stressed.

articles.title: S. Korean Organization Accuses Japan of Shirking Responsibility for Sexual Slavery
articles.content:
S. Korean Organization Accuses Japan of Shirking Responsibility for Sexual Slavery
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- The Council for a Solution to the Issue of the Volunteers Corps in south Korea on March 4 made public a statement condemning Japan for dodging its responsibility for the issue of "comfort women", according to south Korean CBS.
					 It chided the Japanese government for denying state responsibility for the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army enforced against Korean women in the past.
					
					 It urged the Japanese government to fulfill its legal responsibility as early as possible.

articles.title: Stop of North-targeted War Exercises Demanded
articles.content:
Stop of North-targeted War Exercises Demanded
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Civic and public organizations of south Korea including the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification, the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification and the Solidarity for Progress held a meeting in Seoul on March 3 in denunciation of the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean bellicose forces' war drills for aggression.
					 The speakers said at the meeting that the U.S. and the south Korean authorities kicked off madcap Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military drills against the north.
					
					 The military exercises, pursuant to the war plans including the "OPLAN 5027", are obviously the exercises targeted against the north as they are designed to escalate the confrontation of the differing two social systems, they said.
					
					 As long as the war exercises are going on, actions for peace against a war will be steadily conducted, they noted, urging the bellicose forces to stop the saber-rattling at once.

articles.title: S. Korean Internet on Ever-Changing Mode of Activities of Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
S. Korean Internet on Ever-Changing Mode of Activities of Kim Jong Un
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Jaju Minbo, south Korean Internet newspaper, carried an article about the inspection of Panmunjom by Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un.
					 The article said that the author accepted the news of Kim Jong Un's inspection of the truce village of Panmunjom through internet.
					
					 What matters is that the south Korean media learnt of his inspection after Central TV of the DPRK put out the story about it, the article said, and went on: 
					
					 Question is what the south side had been doing when Kim Jong Un toured Panmunjom together with lots of officials, and why the south had been ignorant of it.
					
					 Kim Jong Un had a photo taken on the balcony of Phanmun House in broad daylight with a pair of binoculars close to his eyes. He had the photo taken with general officers and guards of Panmunjom.
					
					 Kim Jong Un stayed in Panmunjom for a long while but the south side was unaware of this and even failed to take a photo of him. Moreover, the south side is now amid high tension as the military exercises are under way.
					
					 The mode of Kim Jong Un can be amounted to "busting hard-line stand".
					
					 The author could be certain of the personality of Kim Jong Un about whom he heard only through rumor as regards the "Cheonan" case in 2010.
					
					 No matter how much plausible evidence the south side may produce, they remain most vulnerable in the north view as it had not been involved in the sinking case. This means that verification of the evidence by experts can easily turn down the rival's assertions.
					
					 Kim Jong Un's mode of counteraction is characterized by neutralizing the rival's assertions and activities by the use of less energy while hitting the weakest point of the enemy.
					
					 Kim Jong Un displays wonderful tricks in reliance on the power of the country, army and people. Analysis of them proves that they are very diverse and ever-changing.
					
					 Kim Jong Un's activities are like the most difficult higher mathematics problem. 
					
					 South Korean experts described his recent visit to Panmunjom as demonstration of his pluck. But they can hardly understand it as they are not able to solve an arithmetic problem.

articles.title: Hideous Provocation of Lee Myung Bak Group of Traitors Denounced
articles.content:
Hideous Provocation of Lee Myung Bak Group of Traitors Denounced
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Ri Tong Je, chairman of the Association of Koreans in Japan for Peaceful Reunification, Monday issued a statement denouncing the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors for perpetrating hideous provocation of hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK.
					 Not satisfied with the recent joint military exercises with the U.S., bringing the situation on Korean Peninsula to the brink of war, the Lee group has without hesitation committed high treasons of hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK, said the statement.
					
					 The days are numbered till the regime of Lee Myung Bak will be judged for the crimes it has perpetrated since it took power, it noted.
					
					 The south Korean authorities and military are well advised to bear in their minds that the DPRK did not make an empty talk when declared in harsh tones that it would react to war provocation with war means more powerful than the nuclear weapons and state-of-the-art striking equipment, it warned.
					
					 The statement urged the Lee Myung Bak regime to kneel before the nation and make an apology for its crimes.

articles.title: Korean Official in Japan Denounces U.S.-S. Korea War Drills
articles.content:
Korean Official in Japan Denounces U.S.-S. Korea War Drills
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Cha Dol, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Youth League in Japan, issued a statement on March 3 denouncing the U.S. and south Korean warmongers for their mad-cap war exercises against the DPRK and the moves of confrontation with fellow countrymen. 
					 He in the statement said that the sovereignty and dignity of the country have been violated and whole south Korea reeks of gunpowder by the war exercises that were kicked off during the period of mourning the loss of the great father of the nation. 
					
					 Not content with this, the south Korean group of traitors let its puppet army units hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK, gravest and unpardonable provocation, he said, and went on:
					
					 The present situation calls upon all the fellow countrymen to turn out in the nationwide sacred war to resolutely frustrate outsiders' aggression moves and sycophantic traitors' acts against the nation and open up the avenue for independent reunification and peace and prosperity of the country. 
					
					 Koreans in the north and the south and overseas will dynamically turn out in the nationwide drive to achieve solidarity and unity, defend peace and remove the root cause of war and confrontation from the stand of national independence, giving priority to the Korean nation.

articles.title: We Will Never Pardon Lee Myung Bak Clique: Korean in Japan
articles.content:
We Will Never Pardon Lee Myung Bak Clique: Korean in Japan 
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Ri Jong Man, managing director of the Standing Council of the Korean Federation of Workers in Commerce in Japan, Monday issued a statement titled "We will smash the war moves and treacherous acts of the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors".
					 The statement said:
					
					 We could hardly repress towering national grudge against the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors who slandered and insulted the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK.
					
					 The noble moral obligation to the leader and invariable will for independence and peace which the DPRK has shown to the world after the sudden loss of the great father of the nation won the world progressives' support and sympathy.
					
					 However, the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors committed thrice-cursed crimes against the Korean nation. They are immoral persons who can never be pardoned.
					
					 We will foil their war moves against the nation and reunification which push the situation to a catastrophe by closely rallying the compatriots in commerce in Japan around the organization.

articles.title: Japanese Authorities' Suppression of Juche Idea Followers in Japan under Fire
articles.content:
Japanese Authorities' Suppression of Juche Idea Followers in Japan under Fire 
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- The Federation of Korean Youth in China made public a statement on Feb. 28 condemning the Japanese customs authorities for their forcible search operations against the delegation of the Japanese organization for the study of the Juche idea.
					 Shortly ago, the customs authorities perpetrated such tyrannical actions as rummaging the luggage of the members of the delegation upon their return to Japan after visiting the DPRK and confiscating books and multimedia they brought with them at Kansai airport and Haneda airport.
					
					 Those confiscated things were books, multimedia and souvenirs they legally purchased while staying in the DPRK and, therefore, they can never be subject to suppression, the statement noted, adding:
					
					 The above-said actions are an open crackdown upon the progressive personages who wish to study and disseminate progressive ideas. Lurking behind this is a sinister intention of Japan to persistently pursue its hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 We can hardly repress the towering national resentment against the unpardonable criminal acts committed by the Japanese customs authorities, the statement noted, urging them to return those confiscated things to their owners without delay and make an immediate apology for those acts.

articles.title: Magazine "Paektu-Halla" Issued
articles.content:
Magazine "Paektu-Halla" Issued
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China released the February issue of its magazine "Paektu-Halla".
					 Carried in the magazine is a photo of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It conveyed news of the field guidance given by Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un to the sites of construction being undertaken by servicepersons.
					
					 The magazine allotted several pages to articles titled "Centenary of Kim Il Sung's Korea, outstanding great man who ushered in a history of victories and miracles, a shining era of speed campaign (1)", "General and CNC", "Undying exploits the leader performed by laying a groundwork for accomplishing the cause of reunification".
					
					 It also conveyed accounts of brisk preparations made by the general association and its affiliated organizations for holding commemorations of the Day of the Shining Star.
					
					 It carried a poem "Accept warm blessings from all people, please" written by a Korean in China.
					
					 The magazine carried articles titled "Let's glorify the exploits performed by the illustrious Songun commander of Mt. Paektu in the efforts to achieve national reunification, holding him in high esteem forever", "Let's bring about a new phase of independent reunification by concerted efforts of the whole nation" and others. It also carried a statement released by the spokesman for the Zhongnan Regional Association of the general association to support the appeal of the North Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration to the all compatriots at home and abroad.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Lauded by Mexican Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Lauded by Mexican Paper
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- The Mexican paper Unidad Nacional on Feb. 29 devoted one whole page to the article titled "Leader of the cause of independence" illustrated with a photo of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 The paper said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il's formulation of the revolutionary ideas of President Kim Il Sung as an integral system of ideology, theory and method of Juche was an event to be specially recorded in the history of the struggle for independence of mankind.
					
					 This provided progressive mankind with a powerful ideological and theoretical weapon for building a new world free from all sorts of domination and subjugation.
					
					 The U.S. styling itself the world's only superpower after the end of the Cold War perpetrated highhanded and arbitrary practices in international arena, committing undisguised aggression and interference in the internal affairs of other countries.
					
					 Under this situation Kim Jong Il held higher the banner of Songun.
					
					 The Songun politics helped protect the sovereignty of the DPRK and its socialism and reliably guarantee the peace and security in the Korean Peninsula and the rest of Northeast Asia and the world.
					
					 It is thanks to the vitality and validity of the Songun politics that its historical meaning and position are increasing as the days go by.
					
					 It has become a trend of the times to follow the Songun politics.
					
					 Introducing the feats Kim Jong Il performed by making an undying contribution to global independence, the paper praised him as a distinguished leader of the present times, most tested political elder who dynamically promoted the triumphant advance of the human cause of independence and a peerlessly great man.

articles.title: Stop to Key Resolve, Foal Eagle Demanded in Different Countries
articles.content:
Stop to Key Resolve, Foal Eagle Demanded in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Bangladesh, Ecuador and Peru issued statements denouncing the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet warmongers for staging the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises.
					 The Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy in a statement on March 1 said that Key Resolve and Foal Eagle targeted against the DPRK clearly showed once again that the U.S. and the south Korean authorities are wreckers of peace as they are keen to ignite a war.
					
					 The present-day situation clearly proves the validity of the Songun politics which helped turn the DPRK into a military power with self-defensive war deterrent, the statement noted.
					
					 The Ecuador-Guaranda Institute for Friendship and Cultural Solidarity with the Korean People in a statement on Feb. 28 said that the U.S. hurled not only its forces occupying south Korea but its forces in the U.S. mainland and the Pacific region into the joint military exercises. The statement condemned this as an undisguised challenge to the efforts of the Korean people and the world people for peace.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists should not forget the lesson drawn from the bitter defeat they suffered in the Korean War in the 1950s, it stressed.
					
					 The Peruvian Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea and the Peruvian Committee for Solidarity with Peoples in their statements on Feb. 28 and 29 denounced Key Resolve and Foal Eagle.
					
					 The joint military exercises are a challenge to the desire of the Korean people for reunification and a total negation of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the October 4 declaration, the programme for implementing it, the statements said, strongly demanding the U.S., south Korea and Japan, its allies, roll back at once their hostile policy toward the DPRK.

articles.title: 5th Session of 11th NPC Opens in China
articles.content:
5th Session of 11th NPC Opens in China 
 Beijing, March 5 (KCNA) -- The 5th session of the 11th National People's Congress of China opened at the Great Hall of the People Monday. 
					 Present at the opening meeting were Hu Jintao and other leading cadres of the party and state of China and delegates. 
					
					 Premier Wen Jiabao delivered a report on the work of the government. 
					
					 In his report he reviewed the work in 2011 and stressed the need to strive for preserving social harmony and stability this year by implementing in depth the scientific outlook on development under the banner of socialism with Chinese characteristics. 
					
					 He set it as major tasks this year to promote a smooth and relatively rapid economic development, maintain basic stability of prices of goods, carry out the state strategy for development and the strategy for building a power in talents by dint of science and education and accelerate the great prosperity of culture.
					
					  Referring to the construction of national defence and army, he underscored the need to comprehensively push forward the revolutionization, modernization and regularization of the army and step up the ideological and political construction and consolidate the unity between the army and the government and the unity between army and people. 
					
					 He noted that China will reinforce the foundation in political, economic, cultural and other fields for the development of cross-Strait relations and thus make further progress in promoting their peaceful development.
					
					 China will boost solidarity and cooperation with many developing countries, deepen the traditional friendship, steadfastly follow the road of peaceful development and maintain an independent and sovereign and peace-loving diplomatic policy, he concluded.

articles.title: Russian Prime Minister Accuses West of Imposing Sanctions on Belarus
articles.content:
Russian Prime Minister Accuses West of Imposing Sanctions on Belarus
 Moscow, March 5 (KCNA) -- Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin criticized the recent sanctions imposed by the West on Belarus.
					 All the sanctions are ineffective and entails outsiders' interference later, he said, adding it was well proved by the situation in Iraq.
					
					 He said sanctions are part of steps to put pressure by force, underscoring the need to avoid the factors of using force in settling international issues and restore the efficiency of international law.

articles.title: Brazil Chides West's Monetary Policy
articles.content:
Brazil Chides West's Monetary Policy
 Pyongyang, March 6 (KCNA) -- Brazilian President Dilma Rousseff, addressing an event on Thursday, accused the West of its monetary policy.
					 Rousseff said the wrong monetary policy of the West is sparking a monetary disaster and putting a very serious impact on the economic development of other countries. 
					
					 She added the government is committed to defending the Brazilian economy from the "currency war" launched by the rich countries.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia mensaje de felicitacion a Putin
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia mensaje de felicitacion a Putin
Pyongyang, 6 de marzo (ACNC) -- El Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un envio este martes el mensaje de felicitacion a Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin en relacion con su eleccion como nuevo presidente de la Federacion Rusa.
					La misiva va como sigue:
					
					Hago llegarle a usted mi felicitacion por su eleccion como presidente de la Federacion Rusa.
					
					Convencido de que las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre Corea y Rusia se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran de acuerdo con los convenios logrados entre los dos paises y los intereses de los pueblos de ambos paises, formulo votos por los exitos en su labor responsable para construir Rusia poderosa.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un expresa agradecimiento especial a Casa de Creacion Mansudae
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un expresa agradecimiento especial a Casa de Creacion Mansudae
Pyongyang, 6 de marzo (ACNC) -- El Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, Kim Jong Un, envio un mensaje de agradecimiento especial a los creadores, empleados y funcionarios de la Casa de Creacion Mansudae quienes realizaron proezas extraordinarias en las labores para eternizar al Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					  En su mensaje, el remitente destaco que expresa agradecimiento especial del Comandante Supremo a los destinatarios que crearon en el maximo nivel el retrato del Dirigente Kim Jong Il con amplia sonrisa anorandolo muchisimo y contribuyeron a la realizacion exitosa de los actos de despedida y condolencias.
					
					  Ademas, construyeron como mejor obra maestra las estatuas de bronce ecuestres del Presidente          Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il para demostrar las nobles personalidades de estos generales insignes del monte Paektu y enaltecerlos de generacion en generacion.
					
					  En otra parte del mensaje, Kim Jong Un evaluo de altos los meritos de los destinatarios.
					
					  Tuvo lugar el dia 6 en la Casa de Creacion Mansudae la ceremonia de transmision del mensaje.
					
					  En la ocasion participaron Kim Ki Nam, miembro del Buro Politico y secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, los funcionarios, creadores y empleados de esa entidad.
					
					  Los oradores pronunciaron discursos de juramento.

articles.title: CRPP critica nueva campana anti-RPDC de la banda de Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
CRPP critica nueva campana anti-RPDC de la banda de Lee Myung Bak
Pyongyang, 6 de marzo (ACNC) -- En estos dias, las autoridades surcoreanas estan enfrascadas en levantar la "oleada anti-Norte".
					Al respecto, el Secretariado del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria (CRPP) dio a la publicidad el dia 6 la informacion no. 993.
					
					El documento sigue:
					
					Deja consternados al interior y exterior la "oleada anti-Norte" que levanta la banda de titeres surcoreanos justamente cuando los uniformados y civiles de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea redoblan la voluntad de aniquilar a los compinches de Lee Myung Bak, enemigo jurado que se atrevio a insultar la maxima dignidad de la RPDC.
					
					Hace poco, la banda de titeres surcoreanos abrio un juicio sobre el caso de la supuesta red de espias, que viene orquestando desde el ano pasado, e impuso a duras penas a los involucrados vinculandolos absurdamente con la RPDC.
					
					Ademas, libro la campana de represion terrible insistiendo en que el editor y el representante de la revista progresista "Minjok 21" realizaron actividades de "espionaje" luego de convertirse en agentes de la RPDC.
					
					Por otra parte, a instigacion de la camarilla surcoreana, unos fulanos y menganos lanzan una campana intrigante para mellar la imagen exterior de la RPDC mientras los medios de prensa venales se dedican a justificar la politica conflictiva.
					
					Por otra parte, bajo el pretexto de la "posibilidad de provocacion" de alguien, se intensifica la "educacion sobre la seguridad" a las generaciones jovenes y se impulsa una serie de trabajos para inyectar en las filas del ejercito titere surcoreano la hostilidad a los connacionales.
					
					Tales hechos vuelven a mostrar la fachada de peor maniaco de guerra de esos traidores.
					
					Los desesperados esfuerzos de ellos por levantar la "oleada anti-Norte" tienen el objetivo de salir de la crisis de arruinamiento y cambiar a su favor la situacion electoral distrayendo la atencion de la opinion publica.
					
					Historicamente, cada vez que afrontaban la crisis de dominacion en visperas de las elecciones, levantaban la "oleada anti-Norte" para frenar el avance de las fuerzas progresistas y eliminar la opinion antigubernamental del pueblo.
					
					En el caso de la banda de Lee Myung Bak, en visperas de las elecciones de autonomia local, las suplementarias y las de alcalde de Seul, orquesto sucesivamente las campanas de provocacion inclusive el hundimiento de la corbeta surcoreana "Cheonan" y el fuego artillero en la isla Yongphyong y los complots psicologicos anti-RPDC movilizando hasta a las escorias humanas 
					
					Lo que conseguiran ellos con ese metodo rutinario es la mayor indignacion del pueblo y el aislamiento de si mismos.
					
					En lugar de sacar lecciones, la banda de Lee intenta salir de su peor crisis levantando nuevamente la "oleada anti-Norte".
					
					Estaria muy equivocada si ella piensa que podria eludir la crisis desviando la opinion publica y calumniando a los connacionales.
					
					Ellos deben dejar de levantar la "oleada anti-Norte" al darse cuenta de que esta oleada se convertira en el tifon anti-Lee Myung Bak y anti-Partido Saenuri que acabara con estos traidores.

articles.title: ACNC y AP coauspiciaran galeria de fotos en EE.UU.
articles.content:
ACNC y AP coauspiciaran galeria de fotos en EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 6 de marzo (ACNC) -- Con motivo del Dia del Sol (15 de abril, fecha de nacimiento del Presidente Kim Il Sung), tendra lugar en Nueva York una exposicion de fotos bajo coauspicios de la Agencia Central de Noticias de Corea (KCNA) y la Associated Press (AP).
					  En la galeria conjunta de fotos, que se inaugurara segun un memorando de entendimiento firmado en junio del ano pasado por ambas agencias, se exhibiran las fotos sobre Corea preparadas por ellas.
					
					  Segun los funcionarios de la ACNC que escogieron junto con la AP las fotos para esa ocasion, se exhibiran las fotografias de los Grandes Hombre del monte Paektu quienes hicieron una contribucion inmortal a la prosperidad del pais, la felicidad del pueblo, la reunificacion independiente y pacifica de Corea y a la realizacion de la causa de independencia del mundo.
					
					  Ademas, se pondran las otras que muestran la politica, la economia, la cultura y otras ramas de Corea.
					
					  En opinion de Santiago Lyon, director de fotografia de la AP, la exhibicion dara a los visitantes la oportunidad de comparar las fotos de diferentes estilos de ambas agencias y permitira a los clientes occidentales tener una comprension visual de la RPDC, pais poco conocido para ellos.
					
					  Esta exposicion contribuira a fomentar la confianza entre los pueblos de la RPDC y EE.UU. y a mejorar las relaciones bilaterales.

articles.title: Llega a 1.94 millones el numero de aspirantes a servicio militar
articles.content:
Llega a 1.94 millones el numero de aspirantes a servicio militar
Pyongyang, 6 de marzo (ACNC) -- Despues de publicada la declaracion del portavoz de la Comandancia Suprema del Ejercito Popular de Corea, se aumenta cada dia mas el numero de jovenes aspirantes al alistamiento o al retorno al servicio militar.
					Su numero llega ahora a mas de un millon 940 mil, inclusive mas de 176 mil 540 jovenes de la provincia de Hwanghae del Norte. 
					
					Decenas de miles de estudiantes de las universidades y escuelas especializadas de la ciudad de Sariwon sostuvieron el encuentro de solicitud de ingreso al ejercito. 
					
					En las solicitudes escritas se ven las letras como "Matemos a palazos a los gangsteres ignorantes como Lee Myung Bak", etc. 
					
					En el acto de juramento de venganza efectuado en el distrito de Songchon de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur, 11 mil 120 jovenes participantes gritaron las consignas "No dejemos escaparse con vida ni a un militar titere surcoreano estacionado en la ciudad de Inchon" y "Ejecutemos despiadadamente a Kim Kwan Jin y Jong Sung Jo en nombre de la nacion". 
					
					Los jovenes del distrito de Ongjin de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur y el distrito de Cholwon de la provincia de Kangwon tambien expresaron la decision de hacerse balas y bombas, cuando se de la orden del Comandante Supremo, para convertir el baluarte de los enemigos en un mar de fuego. 
					
					Mas de 5 mil 280 graduandos de las escuelas secundarias quienes participaron en los examenes para los centros docentes superiores solicitaron a alistarse al EPC.
